intro: Ruellia tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Ruellia tetragona is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
